availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Dunning (Caldwell Co/Christian Co, KY, farmer, corp 6th Ill Cav USA)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of George P. Dunning and Sarah "Sallie" Ashby Dunning. Married to Darthula Ann Brady Dunning in Christian County, Kentucky, on 1860. Student in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Served in the 6th Illinois Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as corporal.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 358A.

Christian County, p. 585.

"John M. Dunning (unknown-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial #49521579, accessed January 28, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49521579.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 33.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, 1857-1875, Film #000465564, p. 48.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Illinois, Application #474920, Certificate #454138.
